candidates.title: Minor: "leptos.workspace = true" is invalid.
candidates.body:
This is a minor comment 

In my IDE .. I have a count of errors in the toolbar.
The error count registers invalid lines in toml files.

As a double check I dumped the root Cargo.toml files in a validator 

https://www.toml-lint.com/

So all my changes are of the form 

```
-leptos.workspace = true
+leptos = { workspace = true }
```

As I see things - This does not uncover any bugs, the original intend of the code in being interpreted without problem.

So it is just a DX thing for me - When I am making changes to the code I always have to ignore a these errors.

candidates.title: Remove a couple extra deps from the axum integration
candidates.body: Basically what it says on the tin

candidates.title: FAVICON!
candidates.body: I added favicons to all the examples. Congrats to underscorefunk on the new logo!

candidates.title: simple_logger use version 4.0.0 everywhere.
candidates.body: This is very minor ... a mix of version number for simple_logger were being used.

candidates.title: Generate Routes and pass them to Actix/Axum
candidates.body:
This PR provides a function to walk the Leptos router's app tree and produce a list of routes. Each integration has conversions to parse them into a format for either Actix or Axum, and then a trait to provide a `.leptos_routes()` extension for their respective routers.

This lets us avoid any wildcard routes for routing leptos! And allows you to define routes in only one place! We can do some server side error handling, and be a better neighbor for other services.

I also put in the changes from #241 which are simplified by this change. Take a look and let me know if you spot any issues. The Actix version especially needs some prodding, it's got some fairly involved regexs, as its pathing is quite different from leptos_router.

The todo_app_sqlite and todo_app_sqlite_axum extensions have been updated to the new format. I'll update the rest if it looks good. @gbj and @akesson does that look right?

candidates.title: Adjust default features for `meta` and `router`
candidates.body: Fixes an issue in which `leptos_meta` and `leptos_router` tried to erroneously use browser APIs on the server side, possibly after recent changes to workspace structure.

candidates.title: Improve CI disk space usage
Additional meta tags — closes issue #158
candidates.body:
This PR refactors some of the internals of the `leptos_meta` package to use the new builder approach, and provides new `<Link/>`, `<Style/>`, and `<Script/>` components. (It also refactors `<Stylesheet/>` to use `<Link/>`, which is fun.)

All of these correctly load and unload when you navigate to/from nested routes.

candidates.title: added `HtmlElement::on_mount`
candidates.body: Uses a combination of async goodness and `request_animation_frame` to efficiently poll to check if the element is a child of `<body />`

candidates.title: Adding `tracing` to `leptos_reactive`
candidates.body: Adds instrumenting for the `tracing` crate to most of the reactive system.

candidates.title: `leptos_macro` improvements to `class:`, `prop:`, `on:`, `:undelegate…
Add CI back to build examples
Stable support for `leptos_dom`
Update all examples to use cargo-leptos and patch integrations for latest cargo-leptos support
candidates.body:
This is the big one that should address #163 and #122. I've updated the actix and axum integrations to support the latest cargo-leptos release, and to still support wasm-pack.

All of the SSR examples should build with cargo leptos watch without any changes, and the READMEs have been updated to mention the new install method.

Huge thanks to @akesson for developing cargo-leptos!

candidates.title: Clean up issues relating to `0.1.0` merge
Changes to leptos, leptos_meta, leptos_actix/leptos_axum, and leptos_config to support cargo-leptos-beta
candidates.body:
Hi @gbj and @akesson, I have made several changes to leptos to support the cargo-leptos beta.

I hope both of you can take some time to review this, especially @akesson since it needs to work with cargo-leptos. I think I have it working with my stack, but would love your input.

Changes:
- Add id prop to `<Stylesheet/>` component to allow cargo-leptos' new css feature to work
- Rename RenderOptions to LeptosOptions and delete KDL file writing
- Read LeptosOptions from Cargo.toml in the [package.metadata.leptos] section, sharing keys with cargo-leptos
- Conditional WASM filename based on PACKAGE_NAME env var. If deploying a bundle built with cargo-leptos, PACKAGE_NAME env var will need to manually set
- Allowed Server Functions to set status of form redirects

This should allow for one source of truth for people using cargo-leptos or wasm-pack, and streamline some things.

It appears that cargo-leptos beta also does not support workspaces, as a bunch of paths are relative to the cargo root, which changes to the workspace root when in a workspace. This will prevent modifying the examples in leptos(and having them run with cargo-leptos watch), at least with the present example format. It shouldn't deter operation with wasm-pack

candidates.title: Allow Headers and Status to be set by components and Server Fns during initial SSR Load
candidates.body: This changes the ways Headers and StatusCode is set so that it can be set once in a server fn or element, and be set during server side rendering.

candidates.title: Give Axum access to Request and allow server functions to set status/headers/cookies
candidates.body:
This PR adds a `RequestParts` struct for Axum so that it can access most of the request, and a ResponseParts struct for Actix/Axum that lets server functions set headers and override status.

This should allow server fns to set cookies and headers, but only not on initial page load via SSR. The todoapp-sqlite and todoapp-sqlite-axum examples show an example of this in `get_todos()`.

The question is whether we want/need the ability to set custom headers/status on initial page load via SSR, and how to do that. I don't think Context exists on page load

candidates.title: Docs improvements
Allows documenting `Component` and `ComponentProps` in a single doc comment
Add config crate and generate file for cargo-leptos to watch
candidates.body:
In an attempt to standardize config with cargo-leptos and use our integrations, I've modified leptos to have a central config for SSR, and to generate a KDL file with config params for cargo-leptos to read.

I also updated the todo-sqlite and todo-sqlite-axum to show what that would look like.

I'd love to get input on this structure. I haven't fixed the tests or docs or most of the examples yet, so this is WIP

candidates.title: Automatically enable the `stable` feature if you're on `stable` Rust
Update Axum examples to latest 0.6 release and streamline them a bit
candidates.body:
Hi,
I updated the Axum examples to the latest 0.6 release and did a bit of housecleaning.
This should address #138

candidates.title: Transition component

chosen_pr.title: Update all examples to use cargo-leptos and patch integrations for latest cargo-leptos support
chosen_pr.body:
This is the big one that should address #163 and #122. I've updated the actix and axum integrations to support the latest cargo-leptos release, and to still support wasm-pack.

All of the SSR examples should build with cargo leptos watch without any changes, and the READMEs have been updated to mention the new install method.

Huge thanks to @akesson for developing cargo-leptos!
